staticherobanner.title: What is Choice?

wiccontent.description:
So why choose a higher rate for natural gas when you could get the same natural gas at a lower rate?

Luckily for you, this is possible because in Ohio you can choose your natural gas supplier!

Huh? What does that mean exactly?
It means you can purchase natural gas from a company (hint hint, Ohio Natural Gas) who may be offering a lower price than your current utility. Compare rates with Ohio Natural Gas and go with the lowest to save big on your natural gas bill!

Why is ONG so great?
We offer flexible plan options, exceptional customer service and outstanding perks.

Plus, when you lock in your natural gas price for the next 6 or 12 months with ONG you can avoid price spikes and fluctuations. You don’t have this option with your regulated utility company, but you do with us! And there are no sign-up fees.

Is switching to ONG difficult?
Not a bit. We handle all the details with NO interruption to your service. Switch in just 3 easy steps.

wiccontent.leftboxdescription:
What does Choice mean?

You can purchase natural gas from a company like Grand Rapids Energy® that may be offering a lower natural gas rate than your current rate. Compare rates with Grand Rapids Energy and you'll see why we're the natural choice.

Why is GRE so great?
We offer flexible plan options, exceptional customer service and outstanding perks.

Plus, when you lock in your natural gas price for the next 6 or 12 months with GRE you can avoid price spikes and fluctuations. You don’t currently have this option with your regulated utility company, but you do with us! And there are no sign-up fees.

Is switching to GRE difficult?
Not a bit. We handle all the details with NO interruption to your service. See the box to the right to see how you can switch in 3 easy steps.

For information about the status of natural gas competition in Michigan, visit the Michigan Public Services Commission.
wiccontent.note: Note: Your gas utility will continue to distribute gas to your location, send you your bill, check for gas leaks and respond to emergencies.
